title: (x) fonts with flourishes - various {gang}
content:
Hey does anybody know if there is a dingbat font out there that has like, well I'm not sure of their name but like "accent lines" like on old circus or western posters - like go around the text like on this shirt (i know it's kind of hard to see - but hopefully you can get the idea of what i'm talking about) [http://splitusa.com/garmfall04/mensfall04/089.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20090822160612/http:/splitusa.com/garmfall04/mensfall04/089.html)  
   
so any idea would be great! thanks

hi tom.   
   
There are tons of Dover books with typographic ornaments, scrolls   
and flourishes ... try bookfinder.com with a   
keyword of 'ornament' or 'flourish"   
or try the design/clip art section at a major bookstore.   
   
btw, that's the work of Hydro 74 ... he started working for Relevant a few months ago.   
   
 [http://www.hydro74.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20090822160612/http:/www.hydro74.com/)

really? wow i thought it looked similar to some of his previous work...   
   
so do you know of any font sites that might have ornaments or flourish dingbats? (\*now that I know the name for those things ha - thanks\*)

Dalliance (emigre) and Bickham Script (adobe) have flourishes.   
   
probably lots of others.   
   
also: lots of hits for 'flourish' at myfonts.com

Ok cool - now that I know what they're called I'll search and see what I can stumble across - thanks a lot for all your help BJ   
   
later

dunno, but I don't think so. Anything specific   
in mind ...
those examples in your second post have some nice ornaments indeed. I wouldn't mind knowing the font on girlspink\_shirt\_zoom.jpg myself, although it's probably a hydro74 custom aswell right?
[Adobe Wood Type Ornaments](http://web.archive.org/web/20090822160612/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/wood-type-ornaments/) may be of interest.

ProDTP, a Russian website, offers [lots of ornaments](http://web.archive.org/web/20090822160612/http:/www.prodtp.ru/modules.php?op=modload&name=Downloads&file=index&req=viewsdownload&sid=26&min=0&orderby=titleA&show=10) in EPS format.   
   
Plenty of other [decorative elements](http://web.archive.org/web/20090822160612/http:/www.prodtp.ru/modules.php?op=modload&name=Downloads&file=index&req=viewdownload&cid=3) as well.

There are a couple of things I see on ProDTP that I like and that are downloadable, but how do you contact them? I don't speak or read Russian and wouldn't want to put something on a commercial site that would cause me problems.   
   
Thanks,   
   
Sharon
